meanings.definition: Remove material from the surface of (a solid body) by vaporization, chipping, or other erosive processes.
meanings.sent1: The laser will ablate the plaque from the teeth.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor used a chisel to ablate excess stone from the statue.
meanings.sent3: Trying to ablate the burnt toast with a hairdryer was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words seemed to ablate his confidence like a laser beam.
meanings.sent5: The sun's heat can ablate the snow on the roof quickly.

meanings.definition: (of a glacier or ice sheet) Lose mass through melting or evaporation.
meanings.sent1: Global warming causes glaciers to ablate at a faster rate.
meanings.sent2: The icebergs ablate under the warm sun during summer.
meanings.sent3: The polar bear watched sadly as the ice continued to ablate.
meanings.sent4: His hopes seemed to ablate like ice melting in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The heatwave made the ice ablate rapidly, revealing the rocky surface beneath.
